This fall marks the 40th anniversary of the equity bull market during which equity markets have generated an impressive 11.7% annualized return. What underlying conditions created such a favorable environment and how are market conditions changing today? What drove the rise of indexing and what might we expect from active management going forward? Can investors balance sustainability goals (related to environmental, social, and governance goals) and return goals? How effective have asset class diversification strategies been and what are expected returns going forward?
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22The%20impact%20of%20inflation%2C%20rising%20interest%20rates%2C%20COVID%2C%20and%20ESG%20on%20expected%20equity%20returns%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20investors%20are%20balancing%20sustainability%20and%20return%20objectives%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Effectiveness%20of%20active%20management%20and%20diversification%20strategies%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]
As Chief Investment Officer and Chairman of Los Angeles Capital's Investment Committee, Hal Reynolds oversees the Firm's investment process. Since co-founding the Firm in 2002, Mr. Reynolds has worked closely with the Research team to develop Investor Preference Theory, the Dynamic Alpha Stock Selection Model, and the Forward Attribution process for developing forwarding looking expected factor returns. Working with the Firm's Research Directors, he develops the firm's research goals and provides guidance on key projects to enhance the stock selection, portfolio construction, and trading processes. As a member of the Portfolio Review Committee, he works with senior members of the portfolio management team to establish key portfolio parameters for portfolio construction and rebalancing and developing procedures for monitoring and controlling portfolio risk. Mr. Reynolds has a BA from the University of Virginia and a MBA from the University of Pittsburgh.
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" ARCHIVE MATERIALS

title_font_options="font_size:20" buttom_link_src="url:https%3A%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2FyeK79q0Iz-E||target:%20_blank|"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1528420045018{padding-right: 5% !important;padding-left: 5% !important;}" col_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" col_shadow_hover="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Navigating the Hyper-Stagflationary Crisis, and protect your portfolio[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]This presentation will look at a number of elements that have produced intractable inflation and how Federal Reserve Policy is now boxed into a horrible, and likely permanent corner. From 1966 to 1981, the stock market experienced what was termed the Invisible Crash, as U.S. stock market indices lost over 70% of their purchasing power over 16 years. The current situation is likely to be a more volatile and even larger version of the same phenomenon. This presentation will show investors how they can combat what is innately a very hostile climate and reverse that polarity so they can benefit and grow their wealth over time, using but not limited to, precious metal and mining stocks.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Understand%20the%20duality%20of%20the%20current%20Global%20Macro%20condition%20and%20the%20reasons%20why%20this%20pernicious%20stagflation%20is%20likely%20to%20be%20with%20us%20for%20years%20to%20come%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Learn%20how%20to%20position%20your%20investment%20capital%20so%20as%20to%20protect%20your%20portfolio%20in%20the%20face%20of%20challenging%20economic%20headwinds%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22Learn%20about%20a%20little%20understood%20segment%20of%20the%20precious%20metals%20arena%2C%20that%20at%20the%20right%20time%2C%20could%20generate%20huge%20percentage%20returns%2C%20and%20how%20to%20zero%20in%20on%20some%20of%20the%20best%20ideas%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]
Frank Barbera is the senior portfolio manager at Financial Sense Wealth Management. With more than thirty five years following capital markets, Frank has served as the CIO for a boutique L.A. based wealth management firm, served as co-portfolio manager and senior strategist for two mutual funds, managed two hedge funds, and managed a significant portion of the capital market investments for The Caruso Family Office for over a decade. In the early 2000's, Frank was featured in Chapter Two of the popular book entitled "Master Traders: Strategies for Superior Returns from Today's Top Traders". Back in 2007, Barbera penned a long series of articles featured on the website FinancialSense.com, where he forecasted in advance, the Global Financial Crisis and the collapse of major financial institutions. Frank has been a regular guest on CNBC, and has been widely quoted in the financial press including Fox Business News, CNBC, The Wall Street Journal, Investor's Business Daily, and Barrons.
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator color="blue"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]

SKIRBALL/WEBINAR ACCESS INFORMATION

PREPAY FOR THIS SKIRBALL OR WEBINAR MEETING ONLY
You may prepay $15 for this Skirball meeting or pay $18 at the door, or pay $15 for the Webinar.
 
THIS PURCHASE SITE WILL CLOSE ON FRIDAY, SEPTEMBER 16 AT 6 PM.
CLICK HERE TO PREPAY FOR THIS WEBINAR MEETING ONLY
 
Please Note:
(1) A webinar registration link for this event will be emailed to payees on two dates: Friday, September 9 and Friday, September 16, at 8:00 pm.
(2) Annual Pass Holders will receive a "name tag pass" at the Skirball Cultural Center at each of the 5 Skirball meetings, and will also receive an email with the registration link for all 10 Webinar meetings.  You will have the choice of viewing the Webinar on screen or attending the Skirball Center in person. Your annual pass gives you access to Skirball or the Webinar for each of the five combo Skirball/Webinar events.
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1639077484345{background-color: #b5ffb6 !important;}"][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
